Allow a default commit event timeout to be set on the gateway. This
value will be used by all commit handlers unless overriden at the
transaction level.

data.commitMessage:
FGJ-12: Basic contract event checkpointing

Refactor contract eventing to use network block eventing instead
of channel chaincode eventing, since the former avoids duplicate
and out-of-order events.

Refactor eventing framework to allow composition of listeners,
including checkpointing, and to simplify replay sessions.

Remove unused checkpoint factory.

Allow contract listeners to be added with a checkpointer.

Change-Id: I7cb1086e7d2702d2375e1ce9859da9916fcd3f60
Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <mark_lewis@uk.ibm.com>
data.subject: FGJ-12: Basic contract event checkpointing

data.commitMessage:
FGJ-12: Close resources on gateway close

Also changed OrderedBlockEventSource so that it can be constructed
with a specific start block number when used by ReplayListenerSession.
This is intended to prevent the OrderedBlockEventSource from being
initialized to an undesired start block by stray events arriving
from the low-level SDK during a replay session, and preventing the
correct blocks from being replayed.

Change-Id: I5376b572ea883331f7d12bdc84bbbf92651c53ac
Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <mark_lewis@uk.ibm.com>
data.subject: FGJ-12: Close resources on gateway close

data.commitMessage:
Query error response handling

Throw an exception immediately on receiving as error response
from a peer, distinguishing it from failure to receive a
response from the peer and failing over to another peer.
Introduced new ContractException to encapsulate transaction
submit/evaluate failures.

Streamline exceptions to hide some of the odd checked exceptions
from the low-level SDK behind unchecked high level exceptions.
Introduced new GatewayRuntimeException to achieve this.

Minor documentation tweaks.

Change-Id: I5022b03b8e97c2de93cd744aeadee01f0377a006
Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <mark_lewis@uk.ibm.com>
data.subject: Query error response handling

data.commitMessage:
Throw IOException for Wallet operations

Wallet errors are caused by access to persistent storage. The
standard IOException is more consistent with this type of error,
and is also used by checkpointers. This helps to distinguish
from actualy gateway exceptions, such as errors returned from
contract invocations.

More Javadoc enhancements.

Change-Id: Ie7b0d6ba0f5d6e3fe17dd08bb1e8964cca7b3d17
Signed-off-by: Mark S. Lewis <mark_lewis@uk.ibm.com>
data.subject: Throw IOException for Wallet operations
